name: fileobj - Hex Editor for Linux/BSD
short_description: fileobj is a portable hex editor with vi like interface. This software is written in Python and works on Python 2.6 or above. It works on Linux, NetBSD, OpenBSD, FreeBSD, DragonFlyBSD and possibly other unix operating systems that support ncurses. This software provides basic vi commands for binary editing. Features include insert, replace, delete data in hexadecimal or ascii, cut and paste, undo and redo, visual select, partial buffer loading, multiple buffers support, multiple windows support, block device (raw disk) support, mapping binary data to C struct, etc. Download v0.7 for Python 2.6, 2.7 or 3.x. Download v0.6 for Python 2.5, 2.6 or 2.7. Python 2.6 and 2.7 works on both versions. Repository is available at GitHub https://github.com/kusumi/fileobj
